titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale College, Records of the Yale Bands
Yale College, Records of the Yale Bands
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 19, 2019 at 07:22

did.unittitle: Yale College, Records of the Yale Bands

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of the Yale Bands, which consists of the Yale Concert Band, the Yale Jazz Ensemble, and the Yale Precision Marching Band.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Forms part of the Record Group 9-E (YRG 9-E), Records documenting Yale College offices, programs, and projects.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collection is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale College, Records of the Yale Bands (RU 1140). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale Band's history begins in 1917, when Lt. Joseph Ellis first assembled a group of instrumentalists to do service for Yale College. Various groups of wind, brass, and percussion players presented concerts at Yale throughout the first half of the 20th century. The Yale Concert Band was formed in 1946 with the appointment of Keith L. Wilson, while the Yale Jazz Ensemble traces its official roots to the 1970s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes photographs, performance memorabilia, correspondence, videos and newsclippings from performances, tours, and other events by the Yale Concert Band, the Yale Jazz Ensemble and the Yale Precision Marching Band.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
